data.title: Harold Lloyd Nicholas (1921-2000)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Harold Nicholas born 1921 Mobile, Mobile, Alabama, United States died 2000 New York City, New York, United States including ancestors + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

[children unknown]

Profile last modified 15 Jan 2023 | Created 9 Aug 2020

This page has been accessed 690 times.

Biography

Harold Nicholas is Notable.

Legendary American tap dancer

Harold and his older brother Fayard comprised the Nicholas Brothers, who were one of the greatest dancing teams in American movie history, appearing in more than 50 movies. One of their idols, Fred Astaire, told them that their "Jumping Jive" dance in the 1943 movie "Stormy Weather" was the greatest performance he had ever seen. He also acted and appeared in Broadway productions.

Harold was born March 27, 1921 in Mobile, Mobile county, Alabama, He was the son of Ulysses Nicholas and Viola Harden.[1]

He married Dorothy Dandridge on September 8, 1942 in Los Angeles, Los Angeles, California. He was 18 years old, born in Mobile, Alabama, an Actor with 20th Century Fox and his parents were both born in Mobile, Alabama. Dorothy was 19 years old, born in Cleveland, Ohio, a Singer and Actress and her father Cyril Dandridge was born in Ohio and her mother Ruby Butler was born in Tennessee. Harold and Dorothy divorced about 1951.

Harold and Dorothy had 1 child, Harolyn Suzanne born September 2, 1943 in Los Angeles, Los Angeles county, California.[2]About the age of 2, doctors discovered that Harolyn had suffered severe brain damage at birth.

Harold died at the age of 79 on July 3, 2000 in New York City, New York and was cremated with his remains interred in Woodlawn Cemetery, Bronx, New York at the head this burial site: Alpine Hill plot, section 173, lot 12. Unmarked.[3]
